page.title: 06CHURCH: HINTON CHARTERHOUSE
page.content: THE{SAINT JOHN THE BAPTIST CHURCH} (GRID REFERENCE 776 584) WAS BUILT IN MEDIAEVAL TIMES, SOME TIME BEFORE 1698. IN THE GROUNDS OF THE CHURCH IS A CEMETERY, WHICH HAS TWO SECTIONS: NEARER THE CHURCH ARE THE OLDER GRAVE STONES, AND ON THE LAND A LITTLE WAY FROM THE CHURCH ARE THE MORE RECENT STONES. THE CHURCH HAS QUITE A LARGE CONGREGATION OF APPROXIMATELY 40-50 ON AN AVERAGE SUNDAY, BUT ON SPECIAL OCCASIONS, SUCH AS CHRISTMAS AND EASTER, ATTENDANCE INCREASES GREATLY. ON FRIDAY THE 12th.OF JULY 1985, THE CONGREGATION REACHED ALMOST 300, WHEN THE GREAT OCCASION WAS THE INVESTITURE OF THE NEW VICAR FOR FRESHFORD, LIMPLEY STOKE AND HINTON CHARTERHOUSE. THIS CONGREGATION INCLUDED THE BISHOP OF BATH AND WELLS, AND TEN OTHER VICARS.
